intro: Lygistum beyrichianum, commonly known as the red-stemmed sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and a dense cluster of spikelets at the top of its stems. The plant produces small, pale yellow to brown flowers, which are typically arranged in compact clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Lygistum beyrichianum plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
